definition: old system/weights and measures of former times
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Then the Yueyang Building was renovated, increasing the original scale and carving on its wall with the poems and verses written by the Masters in the Tang Dynasty and contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 乃重修岳陽樓，增其舊制，刻唐賢今人詩賦於其上。

sentences.english: After Western Jin's south unification, some of the Kingdom Wu's system retained.
sentences.chinese: 西晉統一南方後，孫吳舊制還有所保留。

sentences.english: The schools will not improve education by regressing to the old system .
sentences.chinese: 學校將不會通過恢復舊制來提高教育質量。

definition: to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
Jinxian county in Nanchang 南昌, Jiangxi
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Nêdong county, Tibetan: Sne gdong rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
